rankingList.name: Watchmen by Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons
rankingList.description: A critical and commercial success, Watchmen remains one of the most celebrated works in the comic medium.

rankingList.name: Maus by Art Spiegelman
rankingList.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning graphic novel that narrates the horrors of the Holocaust through the perspective of anthropomorphic characters.

rankingList.name: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns by Frank Miller
rankingList.description: A groundbreaking comic that redefined Batman's mythos, presenting an older, darker version of the character.

rankingList.name: V for Vendetta by Alan Moore and David Lloyd
rankingList.description: A dystopian political thriller set in a near-future Britain governed by a fascist regime.

rankingList.name: The Walking Dead (Series) by Robert Kirkman
rankingList.description: A long-running series that explores the human condition in a world overrun by zombies.

rankingList.name: Bone by Jeff Smith
rankingList.description: A whimsical, yet epic, story blending humor, adventure, and mythology.

rankingList.name: The Sandman by Neil Gaiman
rankingList.description: A genre-defining series that blends mythology, history, and fiction.

rankingList.name: Persepolis by Marjane Satrapi
rankingList.description: A poignant autobiography in graphic novel form, detailing the author's childhood in Iran during and after the Islamic Revolution.

rankingList.name: The Killing Joke by Alan Moore and Brian Bolland
rankingList.description: A definitive Joker story that delves into the psyche of Batman's greatest nemesis.

rankingList.name: Scott Pilgrim (Series) by Bryan Lee O'Malley
rankingList.description: A series blending humor, romance, and video game references, following the adventures of Scott Pilgrim as he battles his girlfriend's evil exes.

rankingList.name: Y: The Last Man by Brian K. Vaughan and Pia Guerra
rankingList.description: A post-apocalyptic story where a young man and his pet monkey may be the last male survivors on Earth.

rankingList.name: 300 by Frank Miller
rankingList.description: A visually stunning retelling of the Battle of Thermopylae, focusing on the bravery of 300 Spartan warriors.

favoritesList.name: Civil War by Mark Millar and Steve McNiven
favoritesList.description: A pivotal crossover event that pits superhero against superhero in a battle over government regulation.

favoritesList.name: Secret Wars by Jonathon Hickman and Esad Ribic
favoritesList.description: A universe-spanning event that redefines the Marvel Universe with new alliances, enemies, and a struggle for power.

favoritesList.name: Silver Surfer: Requiem by J. Michael Straczynski and Esad Ribic
favoritesList.description: A poignant tale reflecting on the life and legacy of the Silver Surfer as he faces his impending demise.

favoritesList.name: Silver Surfer: Parable by Stan Lee and Jean Giraud Moebius
favoritesList.description: A cosmic story exploring the philosophical themes of power, faith, and heroism.

favoritesList.name: Thanos Quest by Jim Starlin and Ron Lim
favoritesList.description: The story of Thanos's journey to collect the Infinity Gems and achieve ultimate power.

favoritesList.name: Truth: Red, White & Black by Robert Morales and Kyle Baker
favoritesList.description: A retelling of the Captain America origin story with a focus on the African-American super-soldiers who were part of the program.

favoritesList.name: Guardians of the Galaxy (2008) by Dan Abnett and Andy Lanning
favoritesList.description: The formation of the modern Guardians of the Galaxy team, blending humor and high-stakes cosmic adventures.

favoritesList.name: X-Men: Grand Design by Ed Piskor
favoritesList.description: A retelling of the X-Men history, blending art and storytelling in a unique, chronological narrative.

favoritesList.name: The Humans by Keenan Marshall Keller and Tom Neely
favoritesList.description: A gritty, raw series set in a world where humans and apes co-exist in a 1970s motorcycle gang setting.

favoritesList.name: Marvels by Kurt Busiek and Alex Ross
favoritesList.description: A visually stunning series that explores the Marvel Universe from the perspective of an ordinary man living among gods.

favoritesList.name: Hip-Hop Family Tree by Ed Piskor
favoritesList.description: A comprehensive, artistic look at the history of hip-hop, capturing the rise of the genre through detailed, comic-book storytelling.

favoritesList.name: Space Riders by Alexis Ziritt and Fabian Rangel Jr.
favoritesList.description: A psychedelic space adventure that follows the misfit crew of the Skullship Santa Muerte.

favoritesList.name: Thor: God of Thunder (2012) by Jason Aaron and Esad Ribic
favoritesList.description: A critically acclaimed run that explores the epic battles of Thor across time, facing the God Butcher and other cosmic threats.

exploreList.name: Saga by Brian K. Vaughan and Fiona Staples
exploreList.description: A sweeping, epic space opera that explores love, family, and war across different worlds.

exploreList.name: The Vision by Tom King and Gabriel Hernandez Walta
exploreList.description: A unique story of the Vision attempting to build a family and live a normal life, only for it to unravel in unexpected ways.

exploreList.name: Locke & Key by Joe Hill and Gabriel Rodriguez
exploreList.description: A dark, imaginative series that blends horror, fantasy, and mystery as the Locke family discovers keys with supernatural powers.

exploreList.name: Daytripper by Fabio Moon and Gabriel Ba
exploreList.description: A beautiful, poignant exploration of life, death, and all the moments in between, set across different possible life paths of one man.

exploreList.name: Hawkeye by Matt Fraction and David Aja
exploreList.description: A grounded, street-level look at Clint Barton, the Avenger known as Hawkeye, and his day-to-day life in New York.

exploreList.name: Strangers in Paradise by Terry Moore
exploreList.description: A long-running, critically acclaimed series that blends romance, crime, and drama in a story about love and identity.

exploreList.name: Monstress by Marjorie Liu and Sana Takeda
exploreList.description: A dark, richly detailed fantasy epic set in a world of magic, monsters, and ancient secrets.

exploreList.name: East of West by Jonathan Hickman and Nick Dragotta
exploreList.description: A dystopian sci-fi western that explores an alternate history where the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse attempt to bring about the end of the world.

exploreList.name: Hellboy by Mike Mignola
exploreList.description: A supernatural horror series that follows Hellboy, a demon summoned to Earth as a child, who fights against dark forces while grappling with his own destiny.

exploreList.name: Superman: Red Son by Mark Millar and Dave Johnson
exploreList.description: An alternate universe story where Superman's rocket lands in the Soviet Union instead of Kansas, leading to a very different world history.

exploreList.name: The Sculptor by Scott McCloud
exploreList.description: A touching, philosophical graphic novel about a sculptor who makes a deal with Death for 200 days of life in exchange for the ability to sculpt anything he can imagine.

exploreList.name: The Saga of the Swamp Thing by Alan Moore
exploreList.description: A redefining run on Swamp Thing that blends horror, environmental themes, and complex character development.
